description: Updates the configuration for a Lambda function URL.

parameters.name: FunctionName
parameters.description: The name or ARN of the Lambda function. Function name --- my-function. Function ARN --- arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:123456789012:function:my-function. Partial ARN --- 123456789012:function:my-function. The length constraint applies only to the full ARN. If you specify only the function name, it is limited to 64 characters in length.

parameters.name: Cors
parameters.description: The cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) settings for your function URL. AllowCredentials (boolean) --- Whether to allow cookies or other credentials in requests to your function URL. The default is false. AllowHeaders (list) --- The HTTP headers that origins can include in requests to your function URL. For example: Date, Keep-Alive, X-Custom-Header. (string) --- AllowMethods (list) --- The HTTP methods that are allowed when calling your function URL. For example: GET, POST, DELETE, or the wildcard character ( *). (string) --- AllowOrigins (list) --- The origins that can access your function URL. You can list any number of specific origins, separated by a comma. For example: https://www.example.com, http://localhost:60905. Alternatively, you can grant access to all origins using the wildcard character ( *). (string) --- ExposeHeaders (list) --- The HTTP headers in your function response that you want to expose to origins that call your function URL. (string) --- MaxAge (integer) --- The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that web browsers can cache results of a preflight request. By default, this is set to 0, which means that the browser doesn't cache results.

nested_params.name: AllowCredentials
nested_params.description: Whether to allow cookies or other credentials in requests to your function URL. The default is false.

nested_params.name: AllowHeaders
nested_params.description: The HTTP headers that origins can include in requests to your function URL. For example: Date, Keep-Alive, X-Custom-Header.

nested_params.name: AllowMethods
nested_params.description: The HTTP methods that are allowed when calling your function URL. For example: GET, POST, DELETE, or the wildcard character ( *).

nested_params.name: AllowOrigins
nested_params.description: The origins that can access your function URL. You can list any number of specific origins, separated by a comma. For example: https://www.example.com, http://localhost:60905. Alternatively, you can grant access to all origins using the wildcard character ( *).

nested_params.name: ExposeHeaders
nested_params.description: The HTTP headers in your function response that you want to expose to origins that call your function URL. For example: Date, Keep-Alive, X-Custom-Header.

nested_params.name: MaxAge
nested_params.description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that web browsers can cache results of a preflight request. By default, this is set to 0, which means that the browser doesn't cache results.

parameters.name: InvokeMode
parameters.description: Use one of the following options: BUFFERED --- This is the default option. Lambda invokes your function using the Invoke API operation. Invocation results are available when the payload is complete. The maximum payload size is 6 MB. RESPONSE_STREAM --- Your function streams payload results as they become available. Lambda invokes your function using the InvokeWithResponseStream API operation. The maximum response payload size is 20 MB, however, you can request a quota increase.

nested_items.name: FunctionUrl
nested_items.description: The HTTP URL endpoint for your function.

nested_items.name: FunctionArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of your function.

nested_items.name: AuthType
nested_items.description: The type of authentication that your function URL uses. Set to AWS_IAM if you want to restrict access to authenticated users only. Set to NONE if you want to bypass IAM authentication to create a public endpoint. For more information, see Security and auth model for Lambda function URLs.

nested_items.name: AllowCredentials
nested_items.description: Whether to allow cookies or other credentials in requests to your function URL. The default is false.

nested_items.name: AllowHeaders
nested_items.description: The HTTP headers that origins can include in requests to your function URL. For example: Date, Keep-Alive, X-Custom-Header.

nested_items.name: AllowMethods
nested_items.description: The HTTP methods that are allowed when calling your function URL. For example: GET, POST, DELETE, or the wildcard character ( *).

nested_items.name: AllowOrigins
nested_items.description: The origins that can access your function URL. You can list any number of specific origins, separated by a comma. For example: https://www.example.com, http://localhost:60905.

nested_items.name: ExposeHeaders
nested_items.description: The HTTP headers in your function response that you want to expose to origins that call your function URL. For example: Date, Keep-Alive, X-Custom-Header.

nested_items.name: MaxAge
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that web browsers can cache results of a preflight request. By default, this is set to 0, which means that the browser doesn't cache results.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: When the function URL was created, in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD).

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: When the function URL configuration was last updated, in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD).

nested_items.name: InvokeMode
nested_items.description: Use one of the following options:
BUFFERED --- This is the default option. Lambda invokes your function using the Invoke API operation. Invocation results are available when the payload is complete. The maximum payload size is 6 MB.

RESPONSE_STREAM --- Your function streams payload results as they become available. Lambda invokes your function using the InvokeWithResponseStream API operation. The maximum response payload size is 20 MB, however, you can request a quota increase.
